name: (2Z)-2-(1,3-Benzodioxol-5-ylmethylene)-6,7-dihydro-5H-[1,3]thiazolo[3,2-a]pyrimidin-3(2H)-one
Reason: 1,3-Benzodioxole base, with a melting point around 106°C, due to the presence of two carbonyl groups and the rigid structure they form. The methylene bridge (O=C1C(SC2=NCCCN12)=Cc4ccc3OCOc3c4) adds rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +10°C. The thiazole ring introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +20°C. The pyrimidine ring (3(2H)-one) adds more rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +30°C. The methylene bridge introduces additional rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +10°C.
